text: Hi Guys, I’m working on setting up the Knowledge Base and was wondering if there’s an option to edit the existing HubL base template for the Knowledge Base. My intention is to add a custom navigation bar to the header of my Knowledge base pages.

Hey <@U06BTMDLUQN> - afaik it's currently not possible to edit the KB templates on the same level as pages/blogs...

You could try to create some sort of overengineered solution by replacing the current nav with your own one by writing some JS in the Header HTML area (Settings -Content -> KB -> Template), but I'd advise against to do so.
From my experience, creating a custom blog template which looks/works like a KB is the easiest solution currently available since it will give you much more functionality than the current KB possibilities

I am trying to find the associations from my contact object to a custom object in an email. I do a look up and print out the results but there isn't any associations being returned. I know the contact I'm testing as the association. Here is the look up I'm using:

```{% set associations = crm_associations(14785969,"USER_DEFINED",18) %}```

Any idea why it is returning:
```(CrmObjectList: { "hasMore" : false, "offset" : 0, "results" : [ ], "total" : 0 })```

When I look at my association definitions table this is what I see: association_definitions:

COMBINEDASSOCIATIONTYPEID: `1-18`
CATEGORY: `USER_DEFINED`
ID: `18`
FROMOBJECTTYPEID: `0-1`
TOOBJECTTYPEID: `2-14785969`
NAME: `organization_to_contact`

Thanks for checking <@U01A3RQBDBN> 
This is so weird
